title: SIC! SIC! SIC!
html:
SIC! SIC! SIC!

From the Summer 2004 issue of Art & Antiques:

“Art mogul Charles Saatchi considers the works consumed in the East London Momart warehouse fire irreplaceable in the history of British art. 'Hell,' 2000, a 28-square-foot installation with hundreds of toy Nazis, by Jake and Dinos Chapman, is one of many pieces that set the art world aflame. Now a glob of burnt plastic, Saatchi reportedly spent $900,000 for the piece.”

[Submitted by Julie May, Los Angeles, California, who says “Poor Saatchi! I hope he can be restored.”]
